aber.dcs.cs22510.clg11.util

Class ProcessData

  • java.lang.Object
    • aber.dcs.cs22510.clg11.util.ProcessData

  • public class ProcessData
extends java.lang.Object
    Responsible for updating the internal record of entrant progress (based on data read in from "times.txt") and for processing new time logs submitted by a user. Has access to the shared Datastore class to allow processing and manipulation of the data collections.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProcessData(Datastore newData)
      Constructor to instantiate a new ProcessData.

      Compares the time of the last read-in time log, with the new time being submitted to check that the user is not entering a time in the past.

      Updates a particular Entrant object to log the fact that they have been excluded from their race.

      Returns the time value of the last read-in time log.

      Obtains all the times from the time log file ("times.txt") before processing each time log.

      Processes each line read in from the "times.txt" file to update the internal record of entrant's progress.

      Processes a new time log submitted by the user by determining whether the entrant is on the correct path or not and updates the "times.txt" file with the resulting time log.

      Processes a new time log submitted by the user by determining whether the entrant is on the correct path or not and updates the "times.txt" file with the resulting time log (Overloaded method for processing medical checkpoints).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProcessData

        public ProcessData(Datastore newData)
        Constructor to instantiate a new ProcessData. Takes the shared data store object created in CMDriver as a parameter to allow accessed to the lists of nodes/entrants/courses loaded in.
        Parameters:
        newData - Datastore object created in CMDriver.

    • Method Detail

      • getLastLoggedTime

        public java.lang.String getLastLoggedTime()
        Returns the time value of the last read-in time log.
        Returns:
        The last time value of the "times.txt" file.

      • obtainEntrant

        public Entrant obtainEntrant(int requiredEntrant)
        Attempts to fetch a specified entrant from the internal collection of entrants.
        Parameters:
        requiredEntrant - The number of the required entrant.
        Returns:
        The specified Entrant object, or NULL.

      • obtainEntrantCourseNodes

        public java.util.ArrayList<Node> obtainEntrantCourseNodes(Entrant selectedEntrant)
        Attempts to fetch the collection of course nodes that make up the course that a specified entrant is registered for.
        Parameters:
        selectedEntrant - The number of the required entrant.
        Returns:
        The collection of course nodes, or NULL.

      • processNewTime

        public void processNewTime(java.lang.String timeDelimiter,
                  int nodeNo,
                  int entrantNo)
                    throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Processes each line read in from the "times.txt" file to update the internal record of entrant's progress. This method is crucial to ensure that any time log updates created by any other running versions of the checkpoint manager are recorded in the internal entrant record within this application.
        Parameters:
        timeDelimiter - The character symbol used to represent the status of the particular time log.
        nodeNo - The number of the node the time log was recorded at.
        entrantNo - The number of the entrant that was recorded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • excludeEntrant

        public void excludeEntrant(int entrantNo)
        Updates a particular Entrant object to log the fact that they have been excluded from their race.
        Parameters:
        entrantNo - The number of the required entrant.

      • processTimeLog

        public java.lang.String processTimeLog(java.util.ArrayList<Node> courseNodes,
                              Entrant selectedEntrant,
                              int newNode,
                              java.lang.String time)
        Processes a new time log submitted by the user by determining whether the entrant is on the correct path or not and updates the "times.txt" file with the resulting time log.
        Parameters:
        courseNodes - The collection of nodes that make up the course the current entrant is registered for.
        selectedEntrant - The current entrant being processed.
        newNode - The newly submitted node that the entrant has arrived at.
        time - The inputted time of the entrant's arrival at the CP.
        Returns:

      • processTimeLog

        public java.lang.String processTimeLog(java.util.ArrayList<Node> courseNodes,
                              Entrant selectedEntrant,
                              int newNode,
                              java.lang.String mcType,
                              java.lang.String time,
                              boolean isExcluded)
        Processes a new time log submitted by the user by determining whether the entrant is on the correct path or not and updates the "times.txt" file with the resulting time log (Overloaded method for processing medical checkpoints).
        Parameters:
        courseNodes - The collection of nodes that make up the course the current entrant is registered for.
        selectedEntrant - The current entrant being processed.
        newNode - The newly submitted node that the entrant has arrived at.
        mcType - Whether the entrant was arriving or departing from the MC.
        time - The inputted time of the entrant's arrival at the CP.
        isExcluded -
        Returns:
        String containing the result of processing the time log.

      • getTimes

        public boolean getTimes()
        Obtains all the times from the time log file ("times.txt") before processing each time log.
        Returns:
        A boolean determining if the file was successfully loaded or not.

      • compareTimes

        public boolean compareTimes(java.lang.String oldTimeString,
                   java.lang.String newTimeString)
        Compares the time of the last read-in time log, with the new time being submitted to check that the user is not entering a time in the past.
        Parameters:
        oldTimeString - The last time value read-in from "times.txt".
        newTimeString - The new time value being submitted by the user.
        Returns:
        A boolean determining if the new time value is in the past.
